intro: Laplacea ekmanii, commonly known as the Ekman's laplacea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a dense, daisy-like pattern. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Laplacea ekmanii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
